responses.rationale: The segment describes the impact (deaths) of the outbreak, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the impact (losses, layoffs) on businesses, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the impact (damages, lost sales) on the industry, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes current impact (declines) and potential future impact (pressure), not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a preparedness/response measure ('start vaccinating birds') without explicit calming keywords.
The segment describes risk factors, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes risk and advises precautions, not a statement of authority capability/preparedness.
The segment describes expected impact (price surge, low stocks), not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment contains a Q5 Reassuring cue ('risk... remains low') alongside preparedness, failing the 'without active reassurance' test.
The segment describes spread and potential future impact (shortages), not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes symptoms/impact, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the scale of impact (slaughtered birds), not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the nature/severity of the virus, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the transmission method, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes preparedness/response measures ('working on blood tests', 'will analyse') without explicit calming keywords.
The segment describes potential future risk, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a response measure ('will be slaughtered to help limit the spread') without explicit calming keywords.
